TITLE.P: 81223104 — Energy Efficiency and Integration of Renewable Energy into the Grid in Bangladesh

SHORT_DESCR.P: Bangladesh is embracing both conventional and renewable sources of energy to meet its existing and steadily growing demand for power. In this process, the country is aiming at exploiting its available solar potential, predominantly promoting grid-connected solar power.

The project “Energy Efficiency and Integration of Renewable Energy into the Grid in Bangladesh” is a part of the development cooperation programme Renewable Energy and Energy Efficiency. The project is designed for a duration of 30 months starting from April 2018.

The Objective of the project is: decision-makers in the energy sector have improved the conditions under which stakeholders can integrate solar power into the grid and improve efficiency in the power grid.

The project will work with relevant ministries and other important stakeholders in the energy sector of Bangladesh to achieve the objective and will follow a multi-stakeholder approach at several levels and will intervene in 3 fields of activity (components), namely; developing required framework conditions, strengthening the technical capabilities of the transmission grid operators to integrate solar energy and improving efficiency monitoring of the distribution grid with focus on smart grid technologies.
GIZ is looking for a consultancy firm that can assist with the implementation of the broad range of activities under the abovementioned components.

AC_QUALITY.AC_CRITERION: Appropriateness of suggested concept and work plan, Technical backstopping / Knowledge Management, Qualification of proposed staff, composition of the team

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: The candidates will be rated in a 3-part process:
1) adherence to formal criteria and completeness of the documents;

2) eligibility of the candidates. This will be evaluated according to the eligibility assessment grid. Criteria are: annual turnover, number of employees, reference projects and technical experience in thematic areas;
3) should more than 6 bidders be eligible, the bids will be evaluated according to the technical assessment grid and according to the following criteria and set percentage Points.
For the comparative evaluation we use the references and declarations submitted by the bidders:
1. technical experience (up to 5 specialist areas, including cross-cutting themes) 50%:
a. Renewable Energy Policy and Strategy 10%;
b. Power System Planning and RE Grid Integration 30%;
Regional experience in the region Southern Asia 15%.
